answer_html: As these two limits are the same and our function \(f(x)\) is bounded below and above by the two functions above, we have that \(\lim_{x \to 4}f(x) = 7\) by the squeeze theorem.
answer_latex:
As these two limits are the same and our function $f(x)$ is bounded
below and above by the two functions above, we have that
$\lim_{x \to 4}f(x) = 7$ by the squeeze theorem.
hints_html:
This question looks ready for an application of the squeeze theorem which states if functions f,g,h are such that

\(g(x) \leq f(x) \leq h(x)\)

and if \(\lim_{x \to a}g(x) = L = \lim_{x \to a}h(x)\), then \(\lim_{x \to a}f(x)= L\).
hints_latex:
This question looks ready for an application of the squeeze theorem
which states if functions \emph{f},\emph{g},\emph{h} are such that

$g(x) \leq f(x) \leq h(x)$

and if $\lim_{x \to a}g(x) = L = \lim_{x \to a}h(x)$, then
$\lim_{x \to a}f(x)= L$.
hints_raw:
This question looks ready for an application of the squeeze theorem which states if functions ''f'',''g'',''h'' are such that

<math>
g(x) \leq f(x) \leq h(x)
</math>

and if <math>\lim_{x \to a}g(x) = L = \lim_{x \to a}h(x) </math>, then <math>\lim_{x \to a}f(x)= L</math>.
question: 3 (b)
sols_html:
Following the advice of the hint since

\(\lim_{x \to 4}(4x-9) = 4(4)-9 = 16-9 = 7\)

and

\(\lim_{x \to 4}(x^{2}-4x+7) = (4)^{2}-4(4)+7 = 16-16+7 = 7\)

As these two limits are the same and our function \(f(x)\) is bounded below and above by the two functions above, we have that \(\lim_{x \to 4}f(x) = 7\) by the squeeze theorem.
sols_latex:
Following the advice of the hint since

$\lim_{x \to 4}(4x-9) = 4(4)-9 = 16-9 = 7$

and

$\lim_{x \to 4}(x^{2}-4x+7) = (4)^{2}-4(4)+7 = 16-16+7 = 7$

As these two limits are the same and our function $f(x)$ is bounded
below and above by the two functions above, we have that
$\lim_{x \to 4}f(x) = 7$ by the squeeze theorem.
sols_raw:
Following the advice of the hint since

<math>
\lim_{x \to 4}(4x-9) = 4(4)-9 = 16-9 = 7
</math>

and

<math>
\lim_{x \to 4}(x^{2}-4x+7) = (4)^{2}-4(4)+7 = 16-16+7 = 7
</math>

As these two limits are the same and our function <math>f(x) </math> is bounded below and above by the two functions above, we have that <math> \lim_{x \to 4}f(x) = 7 </math> by the squeeze theorem.
statement_html:
Short-Answer Questions. Questions 1-4 are short-answer questions. Put your answers in the boxes provided. Simplify your answers as much as possible, and show your work. Each question is worth 3 marks, but not all questions are of equal difficulty.

If \(4x-9 \leq f(x) \leq x^2 -4x + 7\) for \(x \geq 0\), find \(\lim_{x \to 4}f(x)\)
